perturbation.original_text:
1.  DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATIONS
1.1 The following definitions and interpretations shall apply to certain terms used in this Agreement:
(a) Affiliate: A company is the Affiliate of another if either company owns directly or indirectly less than 50% but no less than 10% of its equity.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.  DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATIONS
1.1 The following definitions and interpretations shall apply to certain terms used in this Agreement:
(a) Affiliate: A company is the Affiliate of another if either company owns directly or indirectly no less than 50% of its equity.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Affiliate' requires a minimum of 10% ownership. The modified version removes this minimum threshold, creating a contradiction. This could create disputes about whether certain entities qualify as affiliates for purposes of capacity allocation or other benefits under the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
12. ACQUISITION AND USE OF CAPACITY
12.1 Capacity of APCN 2 can only be used by a carrier.
12.2 Parties shall obtain Allocated Capacity in the form of MIU on an ownership basis as shown in Schedule C, in return for their financial investment as identified in Schedule B.
perturbation.changed_text:
12. ACQUISITION AND USE OF CAPACITY
12.1 Capacity of APCN 2 can be used by any entity, regardless of carrier status.
12.2 Parties shall obtain Allocated Capacity in the form of MIU on an ownership basis as shown in Schedule C, in return for their financial investment as identified in Schedule B.
perturbation.explanation: The original text restricts capacity usage to carriers. The modified text removes this restriction, allowing non-carriers to use the capacity. This directly contradicts the initial statement and opens the door for uncertainty regarding who can access the network.

perturbation.original_text:
31. CONFIDENTIALITY
31.1 All data and information that is acquired or received by any Party in connection with the APCN 2 in anticipation of or under this Agreement shall be held confidential and shall not be divulged in any way to any third party, without the prior approval of the Management Committee.
perturbation.changed_text:
31. CONFIDENTIALITY
31.1 All data and information that is acquired or received by any Party in connection with the APCN 2 in anticipation of or under this Agreement shall be considered public knowledge and can be divulged to any third party without restriction or approval.
perturbation.explanation: The original text strictly enforces confidentiality. The modified version completely negates this, stating all information is public. This creates a strong contradiction about the confidentiality of information related to the APCN 2.
